column5: So I just started a new world and I started in the desert biome in the n/ne. With all those nodes, what’s the best way to route them, and how do you recommend starting? Do you just put foundations down then begin to route belts toward the foundation, or do you get all the production equipment set up first then focus on routing?
My problem is more transporting to my base. Do you just have conveyer poles routing around the terrain?

Yes I do the same! My two problems are the ones you can’t be having: setting up a good spot for a factory, and routing my belts and walkways and foundations. I see all these mega bases with a nice clean bus line but I don’t know where to even begin

Dude in the forest biome toward the bottom right of the map right past the coal and sulfur nodes that are right next to each other, if you go down that hill toward the left there’s a river. At the head of the river there’s a bunch of vines, and you have to tread through the water, and through the vines there’s a cave. As soon as I broke through there were about 8 spiders inside that all just immediately started running toward me while the boss spider was chillin outside waiting for me. Things are just gross. And the noise they make almost blends in with the trees and brush flowing with the wind, which also makes it harder to see them. Stuff’s wild man. And that’s why I love this game. There’s nothing else like it on so many levels it’s awesome

Lmao the good ole swamp. I didn’t know how big this map is until I went up the left side of the map, around into the desert biome, then down through the swamp all the way to the bottom right of the map. I spent most of my time running. No thank you
It’s not the big spiders that bother me. They run around with swagger. The little ones are just human-sized abominations hiding behind rocks and in the brush

With mining, you’re either in or you’re out. There’s no dabbling. If you’re in, hodl and stay in for the long run. It’s not a short term game

I don’t think it’s a bad thing, I think it can be a good thing. My problem is when I’m so far into the game after storing so much that I have large storage containers filled with the same materials. I want to avoid that as I begin my next game. I’ve already made it through the hub upgrades so now I’m on to the milestones. I don’t know whether to explore and make concrete for large foundations or to just slowly expand up and out

I would if I could, I live with four other people and our lease ends in May. I don’t see myself being able to make it that far. Everyone has their own shit going on which I understand. I, like lots of other people, am stuck in this scenario where, in order to make it, I have to just “live say by day and push through”. I’m fuckin tired of doing that. All last year I went through the worst depression period of my life, and in November I was finally about to be fully recovered. How, I’m just back to square one: being around close-minded, disgusting people, and I fucking hate it. I’m too scared to just pull the trigger, and I’m so boxed in I don’t know what to do, or what a good out would be, you feel?

Look into like an ASUS B250 Mining board. You can fit 19 cards into that mug. And risers are super cheap. That’s a board I plan on using in the future but someone else more knowledgeable in here can tell you how well it performs
This is what I aim for then I end up building shit. How do you plan this out? It’s breathtaking

I’m the same way man. My dad is mentally ill and my mom never puts herself first. I have a parent on both extreme ends of the spectrum. 

I don’t talk to my dad anymore and when I go back home I live with my mom currently. Whenever I go home I don’t like being around her, which is really fucked up to say because she does everything for me: pays for tuition, rent, bills, etc. I owe her everything and she expects nothing in return except for me to graduate (which I will be in May). 

However, my mom has become emotionally attached to me (I’m the younger of two kids) and she is emotionally dependent on my sister. It’s a very unhealthy situation, and now that I’m older,  this concept is much more transparent. Since my dad refused to work, my mom has always worked at least two jobs for as long as I can remember. So throughout high school, my mom was at work, my dad was either laying in bed or passed out from mixing alcohol and Vicodin, my sister had her own social life, and I was alone. 

I’ve gotten so used to it. My sister was away at college when my mom left my dad. While my mom was at work, the day we left I spent two hours sneaking essentials down to my car for my mom and myself. After she got off work, she texted my dad and said they were done. 

My mom always tells me that “we were like a unit going through it together”, but I just see it as me just being on my own and figuring out ways to pass the time. My mom thinks that we’re closer than we really are. Also a fucked up thing to say, but that’s reality

Experiencing my mom’s issues first-hand as I get older changes the way I interact with her. Because she’s so delicate and goes out of her way to do things, it’s impossible for her to ever be calm. 


Sorry for the long story, but you are not wrong or a bad person for becoming slowly disconnected from your parents. If anything it shows you’re changing as a person, and on your way to becoming someone you want to be. That’s not a bad thing. That’s something few people figure out early in life.
Too bad there was an article released earlier today about tourists coming back from China with a sickness of some sort
I made my comment out of sarcasm. The fact this is a real thing makes me want to go here for spring break or something lmao

That’s really great to hear! Productivity is one thing, but being productive with things you enjoy is very rejuvenating. Sorry to hear your relationship ended; I hope you find someone :) :hugs:

When you’re depressed you’re so mentally drained. It’s like coming home from working a 12 hour shift at work, but said shift never really stops. Your mind races with thoughts and you can’t get it to slow down. Then when it finally does, you’re exhausted. I’ve been there. It takes a while of being in the right place to get back into the mindset. I was fortunate enough to have a month off of school for winter break and that gave me enough time to recharge my batteries 

Not everyone is as fortunate. I wish you the best of luck in finding a place and time to get away and reground with the world and people around you <3
Thanks for clearing up the countdown. And the billionaire was the guy who was planting trees for the forest who’s dad owned the oil company correct?

I’m sorry you feel this way man. I used to think that about myself. I have been fortunate and lucky to have family support. Not everyone gets that. I hope you get better. The first few steps are the hardest. While you may be alone, you have your own company. Try to enjoy being alone. I’m a bit of a misfit myself, and I found life is better for me with the self-support mentality. It takes time to develop this mentality, however it is worth it

2019 was a shit year. To anyone who is struggling, scared, cornered, stuck, afraid, overwhelmed, etc. You are not alone, and there will always be people supporting you, whether it be family, friends, or random people on the internet. The battle is tough, but you can and will win<3

Right on man I have The Dark Forest right next to me. I’m glad I took physics a year ago because that helped with a lot of the terminology and I work with computers as a side hobby. So, while I don’t read books very often, The Three Body Problem was a book right up my alley that kept me interested and entertained because of the complexity
Okay thanks. That makes a lot more sense now

I stay up until 3 or 4 in the morning; after getting drunk and smoking a little bit. I stay up until I feel like a zombie and physically can’t stay up anymore, then sleep for around 12 hours. Even on medications life sucks. I still have stress dreams and nightmares that are so vivid I wake up covered in sweat, and sometimes I feel like I yell in my sleep. But fuck it. I’ll sleep my days away and stay up almost all night

Yeah same. I talked about it with my family and how I don’t care all that much for Christmas. For me I turned 22 last month, and I just don’t care at all about the holidays. Everybody makes such a huge deal out of holidays like Christmas and I couldn’t care less

That’s a point I was making with this, as drinking frequently is something you do in college. Earlier this year, I did use alcohol to cope with depression. Now I’m past that, and I’m doing so much better. My mom noticed my improvements, and she tells me how she can tell I’m doing much better. But she still worries about every little thing and it’s so frustrating because she essentially disregards what I tell her

As I grow older, the more I realize anyone with a job is contributing to society and providing for themselves and possibly other people. It’s a hard pill to swallow in a lot of cases, however anyone with a job is helping the world’s continuous rotation

Yeah, it was a pretty shitty pun joke. And I didn’t go super into detail because I don’t want to write a novel as to why I resent him. As far as his mental heath issues goes, he’s so delusional about his problems and lives in his own world. He’s one of those people who hates life and is all about Jesus this and Jesus that, but doesn’t have the courage to end his own life. 

When we talked on the phone the other night, I told him I resented him because he was a hardass and went overboard lots of times, but I’m thankful he was like that because people around me are sensitive and soft as fuck, whereas I learned to see what the world is really like at a young age, because of how I was raised

Yeah man it can be dangerous. That’s why when I do drink on them I’m at home and I have everything I need. Luckily no matter how fucked up I get I’m still conscious enough to know not to do anything like try to drive, and my college town is very small so I can walk everywhere

I wasn’t experimenting, it’s something I occasionally do. When I drink on them I keep my pacing so I don’t get absolutely trashed and I see your point. You’re not being negative. It’s an issue I have and I need to fix it
No. There’s nothing that I miss. It was the best feeling when we left, a huge sense of relief
He was a piece of shit, shared nothing in common with me, never made an effort to be a half decent father, was barely never sober, etc etc

You're right on the money in your last paragraph, as depression is comes in waves. I was in bad mental health at the beginning of 2019, and I sought help. 

Over the summer, I thought I had overcome it, but when I came back to school, it was as if I was back at square one: a bad living situation, new stresses and pressures applied, and it took some getting used to. I have 6 out of 16 weeks left in this semester, and it's finally starting to look up grade-wise; I'm finally feeling mentally healthy after being here since the end of August. Unfortunate and terrible timing, but getting help is important for anyone with depression so they don't stay in the constant loop of depression, and it's working out well.

Even tonight, I don't know why I impulsively decided to take a Xanax bar and have a few drinks; that is one beauty of being depressed and sad: as long as you know you're battling up the hill, you can cling onto the sadness to get it out of your system while you still feel down

I'm 21, and I'm telling you, as far as "I don't know who I am", I finally figured out who I am, and ironically, the most of finding myself happened between 18-present, and even now, I'm still figuring out thing about myself. For starters, if you haven't already, take the Myers Briggs test and the DiSC test. The Myers Briggs doesn't test on cognitive skills, it's more situational. But I love taking personality tests. I started taking them recreationally in high school, and they helped me learn a lot about myself early on in life

Also, as you grow up, you realize you're not going to impress everyone, no matter hard you try. And if you do, you're doing something wrong. I've come to learn you can't please everyone, so being yourself will attract the right people you need around you.

And that's my problem: if I just disappear, people who have faith in me and have put in time and money, they'll feel--betrayed
Thank you man I appreciate you asking me these questions I have yet to ask myself. Have a good one man
Plus with them being a part of the problem I can’t really lean on them since I’m growing away from them. I can’t deal with their toxicity

Because since they bitch and moan, and constantly all this week I’ve heard 3 of my 4 roommates yell “I hate my life” or shit like that. I don’t know what’s going on. We’re all in tough situations and I don’t want to butt in

I live in an off campus house and I’ve been in this fraternity since rush week of freshman year. I was a nobody when I came to college, and through these years at college I wouldn’t be who I am without people I’m close with at least around me

I self harm; a few people know it but don’t really talk to me about it. Sometimes the scars on my thighs show and it’s nice that people know. I’ve never fully opened up about it because I’m the least attention seeking person in the fraternity, and other members like me a lot. I can’t just give up and drop the fraternity

I’m in a fraternity and need to be enrolled in at least 12 credit hours to remain active. I already dropped one class so I’m right at 12 hours. There’s still time and projects to bring my grades up but I’m just so fucking exhausted

Oddly specific, unfortunately relatable

Earlier this year I started cutting. I began having intense panic attacks and cutting became a source of relief because the physical pain while having a panic attack created this high. It calmed me down. I still have trouble not cutting, and it’s not a good way to stop anxiety. Definitely talk to a psychiatrist; the worst thing you can do is nothing. You got this!

It’s a common misconception; people think others self-harm for attention when that’s not the case. I have scars on my legs that are fairly new and are sometimes revealed by my shorts being too high up while I’m sitting down. I don’t find it attention seeking because nobody ever asks about them

When my friend found out it was like he already knew what I had been through. I cut again recently so there were fresh and old scars from earlier in the year. Just being around someone who doesn’t judge you is such a mood change and a nice confidence boost to just be yourself
Thank you. Good to hear I’m not the only one who likes their scars. Like you, the scars are a part of me and my past and what I went through

Yeah that’s where my situation becomes awkward. I’m 21 still in college and live with my mom. I’m scheduled to graduate May 2020 and live with her. She recently saw a cut on my leg and I told her I cut. My sister cut too. I have no problem opening up about it. But my mom things that just because I’m on an antidepressant medication my life should be stress free which isn’t the case. I’m still recovering my my bad phase I went through February-April. I’m definitely better and I’m glad I got help. But when I told my mom I cut her response was “I just don’t see how people in your generation think cutting is something to resort to”. She’s also said “well you’re on Zoloft don’t you feel so much better?” It’s like yeah, I feel better, but my mind still races with thoughts and feelings
